page.title: 19ECOLOGY GOLDSBOROUGH AREA
page.content: The{River Nidd}provides a home for birds,fish and other animals.There are many woods in the{Goldsborough } area. These too provide shelter for animals and birds,{house martins}and a pair of{spotted flycatchers}nest on the school.Common birds are{blue tit, {robin,starling}and{house sparrow.} There is a large private wood with both deciduous and coniferous trees providing cover for game. In{1981}children planted{Rowan,Maple, and{Silver Birch}to form a wind break to their playground.Other common trees include{Limes,Horsechestnuts,Sycamore and{Hawthorne. The{disused quarry }to the north-west of the block is now a home for fish and water fowl.The spoil from the quarry is now grown over with grass and wild flowers.
